unlockStrats.name: Missiles
note: With a max of 5 missiles, Crocomire may not stop and shoot farmables often enough to kill it.
So, we're requiring 10 here.

unlockStrats.name: Supers
note: While Crocomire's farmables may drop Supers, the rate is too low to rely on.
If you run out, Croc will most likely push you into the spikes.
It takes 8 Supers to kill croc if you don't let it move forward.

strats.name: Crocomire Speedjump
strats.note: With a precise enough jump, it's possible to avoid acid damage without a shinespark.

strats.name: Ripper Grapple
strats.note: Requires canUseEnemies because this wouldn't work without the Ripper 2 being there.

strats.name: Post Crocomire Farming Room Speed Jump
note: Doesn't require opening the bottom right door, even. Just using the available space and jumping late enough.
It does require killing the Gamets and leaving the drops there so they don't kill your momentum.

strats.name: Speed Blocks Broken
strats.note: This is available if obstacle B can be destroyed by travelling to node 4.

nodes.name: Speed Ramp Junction
nodes.note: This node strictly represents access to the speed ramp *with the speed blocks broken*. If they can't be broken, this node is not considered accessible but node 5 might be.

nodes.name: Small Platforms Junction
nodes.note: This node represents the small platforms above the acid. In some situations, it may be accessible without access to node 4, if the Speed blocks can't be broken.

strats.name: Left-Side Indy Spark
strats.note: Doesn't need hjb. Takes two walljumps, and must do the shinespark at the apex.

strats.name: Indiana Jones Grapple
strats.note: Requires canUseEnemies because this wouldn't work without the Ripper 2's being there.

strats.name: PCJR Bluespace
strats.note: The blocks can be broken if you can generate a blue suit using the previous room's runway, and carry it to the blocks by slowing floating down with Space Jump.

strats.name: Base with Broken Obstacle
note: This exists to guarantee going back is free after the speed blocks have been broken.
None of the other strats can work as a proper substitute.
The base strat requires obstacle A.
The shinespark strat may not be possible.
The stutter-3 is notable and could be turned off.

strats.name: PCJR Stutter-3
strats.note: Commonly known as a stutter-3, this is also doable as a 4-tap.

strats.name: Reverse Indiana Jones Grapple
strats.note: Requires canUseEnemies because this wouldn't work without the Ripper 2's being there.

to.note: No Space Jump strat because that's taken care of by 3 -> 5 -> 1.

strats.name: PCJR Walljump Shinespark to Grapple
strats.note: Fire off the shinespark at the apex of two consecutive walljumps.

strats.name: PCJR Big Jump Shinespark
strats.note: Charge a spark to the right, then come back, run and jump, and do a horizontal spark at the apex.

to.note: Since node 4 is only accessed if Speed blocks are broken, access back to 2 is free
All strats that don't require speed blocks to be broken are in 5 -> 3.

strats.name: PCJR Door IBJ
strats.note: Separate strat because it has to start in midair. Maybe also make a tech for that later?

strats.name: PCJR Frozen Mella Door
note: Obstacle B is present here because you need access to node 2 to bring a Mella over.
Then you need to manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.

to.note: If the speed blocks are broken, free access can be attained via node 4

strats.name: Indy Jones Short Mella
note: Obstacle B is present here because you need access to node 2 to bring a Mella over.
Then you need to manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.

strats.name: Indy Jones Long Mella
note: Obstacle B is present here because you need access to node 2 to bring a Mella over.
Then you need to manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.

strats.name: PCJR Acid Shinespark
strats.note: Gravity makes it possible to charge a spark in the acid and get to node 4.

strats.name: Grapple Tutorial Frozen Gamet
note: 1- Bring a Gamet above the water line.
2- Freeze the Gamet before it starts moving left.
3- Cross the first moat.
4- Wait for it to thaw and freeze it a second time to cross the second moat.

strats.name: Grapple Tutorial Double Dboost
note: 1- Stand near the farm point, on the edge of where you make Gamets spawn.
2- Wait for the proper water position.
3- Move to make the Gamets spawn. Moonwalk useful here.
4- Quickly climb up to the last ledge before the dor.
5- Move as far left as possible, wait for the Gamets to start deploying vertically.
6- Run, jump, dboost off a Gamet. Make sure you make the top one move right.
7- Dboost a second time off the Gamet to cross the second moat.
